data.text:
Top 5 things to do on a NYC trip

Visit the Empire State Building or One World Trade

Take a walk through Central Park

Pay the Statue of Liberty a visit

Explore the exhibits at the American Museum of Natural History, the Met, or MoMA

Go see a Broadway show

If you’ve never taken a trip to New York City, you’re in for a treat. The city is the embodiment of excitement, and you’ll never run out of things to do, so be sure to plan accordingly.

Your NYC trip will be full of historically and culturally rich attractions, but be sure to keep up with the locals and look where you’re walking. You don’t want to cause a traffic jam!

The Big Apple lives up to its reputation with all the stunning skyscrapers, exquisite food, and other fun activities. When you take a trip to NYC, you will not be disappointed.

Whether you plan on traversing the city on foot or via tour bus, there’s no wrong way to do it. You can plan your trip to NYC however you wish!

Want some more tips to plan your New York City trip? Keep reading!

Transportation options in New York City

Our bus to New York City drops you off at 34th Street between 11th and 12th Avenue, across from the Javits Convention Center. From there, you have numerous options to get around.

When you travel to New York City, you have one of the most accessible metros at your disposal. The city’s extensive subway and bus network can get you wherever you need to be.

Alternatively, taxis are easy to hail, and you’ll never have trouble booking rideshare.

If all else fails, the city boasts wide sidewalks and rentable bikes that you can use in dedicated bike lanes. The transportation options truly are plentiful!

Best places to stay in New York City

After your long, exhaustive day of sightseeing, you’re going to need a place to crash. New York City is widely known for its amenities and extensive hotel accommodations.

There are hundreds of luxury hotels to choose from, making a trip to New York City accessible for any traveler.

The largest hotels would be in Midtown Manhattan such as the New York Hilton and the New York Marriot Marquis, which boast over 1900 rooms and are quite lavish.

Alternatively, many hotels such as the Pod 39, BKLYN House Hotel, or other rentals are available at a lower cost and offer plenty of travel options for your trip to New York City.

Nightlife in New York City

New York City isn’t called the city that never sleeps for nothing. There are nightlife activities all around you!

If you’re looking for cocktails while on your trip to New York City, locals and tourists alike consider Employees Only one of the best bars in the whole city. This 1920s throwback bar on Hudson St. is known for its inventive drinks and its Prohibition-style interior.

Another great spot for drinks on your trip to New York City is The Dead Rabbit Grocery and Grog. Voted one of the best bars in the world, this 3-floor bar provides plenty of small plate options, vintage cocktails, wines, and more.

The Rockwood Music Hall is an outstanding venue if you’re interested in live music.

Where to shop on your New York City trip

What’s beautiful about going on a trip to New York City is you can find somewhere to shop on just about any street.

Whether you prefer thrifted items or name brands, there will be no shortage of shopping options when you take a trip to NYC.

Scoring a deal in Chinatown, window shopping on Fifth Avenue, and finding that perfect King Kong Empire State Building souvenir are all possible in The Big Apple.

Make sure to hit up many of the numerous large department stores downtown on your next trip to New York City, such as Bloomingdales, Tiffany, or Bergdorf Goodman.

Greenwich Village has countless specialty stores for books, records, antiques, and much more.

Perhaps the best part about all these shopping options is that all sorts of dining options are just blocks away – ranging from pizzerias to fine dining!

Best free things to do in New York City

Even the most frugal travels can make the most of their trip to New York City.

Whether you want to stroll through the gorgeous public parks, ogle at the bright lights of Times Square, or take in the breathtaking view atop the High Line, there are countless ways to travel to NYC on a budget.

If you plan on dining out, be sure to do some research on your restaurants. Many eateries host live music, trivia, karaoke, and other activities at no additional cost!
